content:
• Thursday, January 24, 2013
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) reportedly guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of ~$201M and EPS of...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) reportedly guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of ~$201M and EPS of $0.29-$0.32. Shares +8.2% AH, paring some of the gains they saw on news of a huge Q4 beat, but still up strongly. Deferred revenue reached $250.8M in Q4, up from $226.9M in Q3 and $214.6M in Q4 '11. Some other big data/analytics plays, such as SPLK, TIBX, BIRT, QLIK, TDC, and MSTR, could rally tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) +1.2% AH following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ1 report....

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) +1.2% AH following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ1 report. Starbucks mentioned on its call it sold 175M K-Cups during the quarter; a year ago, it shipped 100M K-Cups over 2 months. Starbucks also mentioned its January U.S. same-store growth has thus far been consistent with FQ1 levels,. The coffee chain plans to open 30+ new Teavana stores by year's end, launch new single-serve Verismo machines, and have 1,500 stores in China by 2015. Shares +3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • TPX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TPX +18%. INFA +12%. RMD +6%. KLAC +3%. QIHU +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TPX +18%. INFA +12%. RMD +6%. KLAC +3%. QIHU +3%.
    After-hours top losers: SCSS -17%. FLEX -7%. SFL -6%. ETFC -5%. CPHD -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • TPX

    Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) rips higher in the post session as its Q4 easily beat Street...

    Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) rips higher in the post session as its Q4 easily beat Street expectations. Net earnings fell 58% Y/Y however, on weaker mattress sales and tighter margins. The company also posted mixed guidance for FY13, expecting to earn $2.55 on revenue of roughly $1.43B. Analysts are looking for $2.72 on $1.43 billion, respectively. The strong upside move likely has to do more with short covering. Recent market data has short interest pegged at 5.64M shares, or 9.3% of its float, which is a formidable position even for a multi-billion dollar company. Shares +17.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • CRUS

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Cirrus Logic (CRUS - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $200M-$220M,...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Cirrus Logic (CRUS - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $200M-$220M, below a $234.9M consensus. This seems priced in following recent events. 2) Maxim (MXIM - earnings) expects FQ3 revenue of $580M-$610M and EPS of $0.39-$0.43, in-line with a consensus of $599.2M and $0.40. 3) Flextronics (FLEX - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $5B-$5.3B and EPS of $0.11-$0.15, below a consensus of $5.69B and $0.20. CRUS +1% AH. FLEX -7.7%. MXIM unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • ETFC

    More on E*Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q4 earnings: DARTs of 128K, -1% Q/Q, -9% Y/Y. $201B in customer...

    More on E*Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q4 earnings: DARTs of 128K, -1% Q/Q, -9% Y/Y. $201B in customer assets, +16.9% Y/Y. Net interest income of $260M, -10% Y/Y. NIM of 2.38%, up 10 bps on the Q. Loan portfolio of $10.6B, down from $13.2B a year ago. Net charge-offs of $102, down from $159M in Q3. Loan loss allowance of $481M, down from $509M in Q3. Trading is lousy, the interest spread is lousy, the loan numbers are improving. Shares -4.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • OTEX

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ2 EPS of $1.58 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $352.2M (+10% Y/Y) beats by...

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ2 EPS of $1.58 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $352.2M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $65.9M (-7.1%...

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $65.9M (-7.1% Y/Y) misses by $0.01M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • EGHT

    8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT): FQ3 EPS of $0.05 in-line. Revenue of $27.3M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -9%...

    8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT): FQ3 EPS of $0.05 in-line. Revenue of $27.3M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • JNPR

    More on Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): 4Q results easily beat management's downbeat guidance from...

    More on Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): 4Q results easily beat management's downbeat guidance from three months ago. 1Q profit guidance straddles the mid-range of analysts' target estimate, and revenue is expected to be on the soft side in the range of $1.05B to $1.07B. Shares -1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $143M (-1.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $143M (-1.7% Y/Y) beats by $5.29M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC): FQ2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $673M (+5% Y/Y) beats by...

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC): FQ2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $673M (+5% Y/Y) beats by $38.1M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SBUX

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ1: The company reports comparable store sales were up...

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ1: The company reports comparable store sales were up 6%, with traffic gaining 4% and ticket prices rising 2%. By region, China/Asia Pacific showed the strongest growth rate at 11%. More than 150K Verismo machines have been sold since the product launch. Operating margin up 30 bps to 16.6% due to what the company calls "increased sales leverage." Previous FY13 growth targets are affirmed. On buybacks, Starbucks says it still as 29M shares on its repurchase plan after burning through 8M shares in FQ1. SBUX -1.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • RMD

    ResMed (NYSE:RMD): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $376.5M (+13% Y/Y) beats by...

    ResMed (NYSE:RMD): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $376.5M (+13% Y/Y) beats by $12.74M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.14B (+2% Y/Y) beats...

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.14B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $234.7M (+3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $234.7M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $17.25M. Shares +15% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +1.5%) CEO Brian Ferguson says it has refining capacity, supply...

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +1.5%) CEO Brian Ferguson says it has refining capacity, supply arrangements and hedging contracts in place to deal with 90% of its exposure to deeply discounted Canadian heavy crude oil prices this year. CVE and JV partner Phillips 66 also are working on ways to "debottleneck" the 362K bbl/day Wood River refinery to increase its capacity to process heavy crude by 5%-10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • FMCN

    More on Focus Media: Muddy Waters, fresh off attacking Qihoo, has issued a note (.pdf) accusing...

    More on Focus Media: Muddy Waters, fresh off attacking Qihoo, has issued a note (.pdf) accusing Focus Media (FMCN -3.1%) of carrying out "at least 21 acquisitions and disposals ... intended to either round-trip money that would come back in as revenue, or provide an excuse for FMCN’s low cash balances." The firm made similar accusations (I, II) a year ago. FMCN is now at $24.97, soundly below its $27/share acquisition price. Carlyle, which is taking part in the deal, remains committed.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • MT

    Weak demand prompts ArcelorMittal (MT -2.2%) to permanently close six production lines at a...

    Weak demand prompts ArcelorMittal (MT -2.2%) to permanently close six production lines at a factory in Liège, Belgium, that make finished steel products for the auto industry, and a coke plant, where fuel for blast furnaces is produced. European steel demand is 29% below pre-financial crisis levels with no improvement seen over the medium term, MT says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 5 Comments
  • DXJ

    The yen's decline is the real deal, says George Soros holding court at Davos, and it's going to...

    The yen's decline is the real deal, says George Soros holding court at Davos, and it's going to make for some unhappy German exporters. The euro, he says, is the outlier currency as the ECB stands alone among the major central banks in not engaging in QE. His comments hit an already weak yen, sending the dollar higher against it by 1.8% to ¥90.20. The hedged Japan equity fund (NYSEARCA:DXJ) +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 7 Comments
  • OSIS

    Shares of OSI Systems (OSIS -18%) take a bit hit today after its FQ2 revenue fell short of...

    Shares of OSI Systems (OSIS -18%) take a bit hit today after its FQ2 revenue fell short of analyst estimates. The company also cut guidance for FY13, now expecting revenues of $850M - $875M, below consensus estimates of $876.5M. Last week, the company said its Rapiscan unit would no longer provide software development for body-scanning machines used in U.S. airports, but would maintain its agreement to provide the U.S. Transportation Security Administration with imaging systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • BPOP

    Popular (BPOP +12.2%) soars after earnings, though nearly the entire beat was due to a $27M...

    Popular (BPOP +12.2%) soars after earnings, though nearly the entire beat was due to a $27M after-tax gain from the bank's interest in EVERTEC (CC transcript). Improving credit performance was key as the bank saw its largest decline ($125M) in nonperforming loans for this cycle. Importantly, notes CFO Richard Carrion, the decline was done without the assist of a bulk loan sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU +1.4%) is tagged Charles Rotblut's "Sell of the Week" after earnings guidance...

    Lululemon (LULU +1.4%) is tagged Charles Rotblut's "Sell of the Week" after earnings guidance from the yoga apparel seller didn't keep up with the lofty expectations set by analysts. Despite already falling 17% off its 52-week high, Rosblut thinks current valuations numbers on LULU suggest more steam needs to blown off.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • KEY

    "You can't shrink yourself to prosperity," says KeyCorp (KEY -1.2%) CEO Beth Mooney on the...

    "You can't shrink yourself to prosperity," says KeyCorp (KEY -1.2%) CEO Beth Mooney on the earnings call (transcript). "If we see opportunities in the market to add bankers," says CFO Jeff Weeden, "we will add bankers to grow revenue." Makes sense? Not to the analyst community which was hoping to see a focus on cost-cutting. Instead non-interest expense grew nearly 7% Y/Y (slide presentation).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUXL

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -2%) slips today after saying its planning a $200M offering of...

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -2%) slips today after saying its planning a $200M offering of convertible senior notes due 2018.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • IOC

    InterOil's (IOC +8.5%) self-imposed deadline for final binding bids from potential partners in...

    InterOil's (IOC +8.5%) self-imposed deadline for final binding bids from potential partners in its Papua New Guinea project is encouraging, Raymond James says, because it signifies management's comfort with what's now on the table. But short interest is ramping up as deal skepticism remains, and the firm warns IOC is setting up for a short squeeze once the partnership news comes out.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG -1%) slips after posting a lackluster Q4 report, with earnings matching analyst...

    Celgene (CELG -1%) slips after posting a lackluster Q4 report, with earnings matching analyst expectations while revenue falls just short of estimates. The company reaffirms its FY13 outlook with revenue just shy of expectations, expecting to earn between $5.50 to $5.60 a share with 11% sales growth on around $6B in sales. The Street is looking for an EPS of $5.64 on $6.1B in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +0.3%) and Methanex (MEOX +8%) sign a 10-year supply contract in which...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +0.3%) and Methanex (MEOX +8%) sign a 10-year supply contract in which CHK will supply the natural gas needed for MEOX's 1M metric ton/year methanol plant in Louisiana. MEOX says the deal reduces its exposure to short-term natural gas price fluctuations, which would lower the gas price risk for the site if it wants to relocate a second plant to Louisiana.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • ALB

    Albemarle (ALB -5.2%) is cut to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, which sees no near-term...

    Albemarle (ALB -5.2%) is cut to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, which sees no near-term catalysts after the specialty chemical maker's Q4 results, as 2013 EPS will be back-end loaded and valuation is fair at 13.2x estimated EPS. With H1 EPS expected down 17% Y/Y, the firm believes the shares will be range-bound for now.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com (OSTK +8.1%) surges after reporting Q4 revenue of $342M (+9% Y/Y, the highest...

    Overstock.com (OSTK +8.1%) surges after reporting Q4 revenue of $342M (+9% Y/Y, the highest growth rate in years) and EPS of $0.37 (up from -$0.15 in Q4 '11). EPS was lifted by a 170 bps Y/Y increase in gross margin to 17.9%, and a 4% drop in G&A/technology spending to $32.7M. Average order size rose 15% Y/Y to $132. Bigger peers Amazon (AMZN +1.7%) and eBay (EBAY +2.3%) are also higher. (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • HXL

    Hexcel (HXL +2%) moves up despite missing its Q4 results late yesterday. Total sales reached a...

    Hexcel (HXL +2%) moves up despite missing its Q4 results late yesterday. Total sales reached a record, up 9% Y/Y on solid performance from all units. Space & Defense revenues grew 21.1%, while Commercial Aerospace sales rose by 11.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • IRBT

    iRobot (IRBT +10.8%) takes off after announcing its expensive RP-VITA remote presence robot has...

    iRobot (IRBT +10.8%) takes off after announcing its expensive RP-VITA remote presence robot has been approved by the FDA for hospital use. Developed in collaboration with private InTouch Health, the RP-VITA relies on an iPad-based UI and built-in videoconferencing system to enable remote doctor/patient consults. It also has an autonomous navigation system.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • CY

    Cypress Semi (CY -2.3%) has turned negative after guiding on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of...

    Cypress Semi (CY -2.3%) has turned negative after guiding on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $163M-$170M and EPS of $0.00-$0.02, below a consensus of $173.9M and $0.04. Meanwhile, fellow chipmaker Fairchild (FCS +4.8%) is up strongly post-earnings. Though Q4 revenue missed estimates and Q1 guidance for revenue of $330M-$350M is only in-line with a $345.8M consensus, expectations were low going in. Also, Fairchild stated it has a "solidly positive" Q1 book-to-bill thus far.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.6%) trades higher a day after David Einhorn admits his...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.6%) trades higher a day after David Einhorn admits his short position in the company wrecked his hedge fund's Q4 portfolio return. Without any company-specific news out, the working theory is that some shorts are giving up the ghost after Einhorn's bear bet backfired. (Greenlight Capital letter .pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • FFIV

    A few networking stocks are rallying in response to F5's (FFIV +5.5%) better-than-feared results...

    A few networking stocks are rallying in response to F5's (FFIV +5.5%) better-than-feared results and guidance. RVBD +3.2%. CTXS +1.5%. FTNT +2.2%. FIRE +2.1%. F5 noted on its earnings call it saw 20% Y/Y growth in telco sales (mobile/cloud-driven), and was able to displace Cisco (previous) at 3 Fortune 50 companies. U.S. federal was a weak spot, and $50M worth of shares were repurchased. William Blair thinks F5's diversification efforts are paying off.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.4%) slips today after pricing its 15.3M share offering at $19.60...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.4%) slips today after pricing its 15.3M share offering at $19.60 a share, a 1.3% discount to Wednesday's close. The company's float stands at around 166.3M shares. ARIA plans to use the proceeds for making and marketing its leukemia treatment Iclusig and for developing its other drug candidates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • OSTK

    Shares of Overstock.com (OSTK +8.9%) move higher after the company reports improved profits as...

    Shares of Overstock.com (OSTK +8.9%) move higher after the company reports improved profits as it was able to generate a higher average order size off of its website. RetailGeeks has the chart that speaks a thousand words in comparing the online seller's margins to Amazon over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • JAXB

    Midday top 10 gainers: JAXB +62%. NFLX +38%. SWFT +25%. TZOO +25%. HMNF +25%. CWBC +16%. YOD...

    Midday top 10 gainers: JAXB +62%. NFLX +38%. SWFT +25%. TZOO +25%. HMNF +25%. CWBC +16%. YOD +16%. FDML +16%. BIOD +15%. TA +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OSIS -14%. CCCL -12%. WHX -12%. FBC -12%. LOCM -11%. AAPL -11%. GV -10%. SNBC -10%. SNFCA -10%. DLHC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MLNX

    Here's a surprise: Mellanox (MLNX -0.1%) is near breakeven after guiding for Q1 revenue about...

    Here's a surprise: Mellanox (MLNX -0.1%) is near breakeven after guiding for Q1 revenue about 40% below consensus. The fact shares (initially down 25% AH) had already been more than halved since September is undoubtedly a big reason why. Management noted on the earnings call one of its OEM customers saw a $30M inventory buildup that will be burned through in Q1, and expects growth to resume in Q2 and continue through 2013. (Q4 results) (Jan. 2 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • KBH

    KB Homes (KBH -2%) slips today after earlier pricing an offering of 5.5M shares at $18.25, a 2%...

    KB Homes (KBH -2%) slips today after earlier pricing an offering of 5.5M shares at $18.25, a 2% discount to Wednesday's close. The home builder also said it plans to offer $200M of 1.375% convertible senior notes due 2019. MKM says that although there may be some near term weakness on the news, it still trades at a discount at its peers and is worth buying on the dip.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • URI

    United Rentals (URI +2.8%) gains after posting a solid bottom-line beat on its Q4 late...

    United Rentals (URI +2.8%) gains after posting a solid bottom-line beat on its Q4 late yesterday, and in spite of the slight miss on revenue. Net earnings rose 41% Y/Y as the equipment-rental company continues to see a recovery in demand, higher rental rates and a boost from its RSC Holdings acquisition last April. The company also gave a cautious revenue outlook for 2013, now expecting to earn between $4.9B to $5.1B, which is below Street estimates of $5.18B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +4.1%) is an Apple supplier and issued light guidance on its earnings call . yet...

    SanDisk (SNDK +4.1%) is an Apple supplier and issued light guidance on its earnings call ... yet shares have rallied to within $2 of their 52-week high. Why? Because the guidance - Q1 revenue of $1.225B-$1.3B ($1.37B consensus) and 2013 revenue of $5.3B-$5.6B ($6.01B consensus) - is accompanied by a forecast for just 30%-40% NAND flash industry bit growth, and lower bit growth from SanDisk. That's fueling hopes of a healthier pricing/margin environment - gross margin fell 300 bps Y/Y in Q4 to 39.9%. Needham has upgraded shares to Buy. MU +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $4.50 price target, down from...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $4.50 price target, down from $6.50, at Jefferies, following a reserve report which showed MHR's resources acquired and discovered are less prolific and more expensive than expected. But 2013 could be a turning point if MHR succeeds at selling high-cost properties and managing its overspending.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • HNT

    In addition to its reaching an agreement with Health Net (HNT +1%) on reimbursement rates, Tenet...

    In addition to its reaching an agreement with Health Net (HNT +1%) on reimbursement rates, Tenet Healthcare (THC +3.5%) gets an added boost from an upgrade to Outperform at Raymond James. The firm says that despite the run we've already seen in hospital stocks, there's still room for THC. The company has solid free cash flow and its refinancing efforts will only add more that down the road. Additional growth drivers, such as the Conifer health-information business and benefits from the health-care overhaul, should help propel the stock higher over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • TA

    TravelCenters of America (TA +11.2%) registers a gain after Craig-Hallum initiates coverage on...

    TravelCenters of America (TA +11.2%) registers a gain after Craig-Hallum initiates coverage on the company with a Buy rating and $13 price target. For the year, shares are already up over 33% as the company stays on an aggressive growth track.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (FMCN -4.6%) dives after Bloomberg reports the SEC is probing the Chinese LCD ad...

    Focus Media (FMCN -4.6%) dives after Bloomberg reports the SEC is probing the Chinese LCD ad network owner for possible violations. Muddy Waters has accused FMCN of fraud in the past. The company is in the process of going private.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • NE

    Noble Corp. (NE -4%) is a big decliner among energy stocks after Q4 earnings came in roughly...

    Noble Corp. (NE -4%) is a big decliner among energy stocks after Q4 earnings came in roughly flat Y/Y earlier as higher revenue from contract drilling services was offset by repair costs and other operating expenses. It was "not a great quarter [but] the operational results were near the pin,” Simmons analysts say. NE sees Q1 contract drilling services of $485M-$495M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +3.1%) moves up today after reporting an in-line Q4 on a 16% jump...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +3.1%) moves up today after reporting an in-line Q4 on a 16% jump in total sales. Net earnings more than quintupled however, as the drug developer racked up much stronger sales, and last year's results were weighed down by higher income-tax provisions. Sales of Cubicin, an intravenous antibiotic for skin and bloodstream infections, jumped 14% to $216M in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • BB

    RIM (RIMM +4.3%) has shot higher after Lenovo (OTCPK:LNVGY) CFO Wong Dai suggests his company is...

    RIM (RIMM +4.3%) has shot higher after Lenovo (OTCPK:LNVGY) CFO Wong Dai suggests his company is open to buying RIM. "We are looking at all opportunities -- RIM and many others" spoke Dai at Davos, while noting RIM's run-up makes a deal more expensive. The comments come shortly after Thorsten Heins mentioned the possibility of selling RIM's hardware ops, something a Canadian government official didn't sound enthusiastic about. Lenovo's smartphone sales have surged lately.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 9 Comments
  • ERJ

    Brazilian aircraft maker Embraer (ERJ +9.7%) pops after announcing earlier that its inked a...

    Brazilian aircraft maker Embraer (ERJ +9.7%) pops after announcing earlier that its inked a contract with Republic Airways (RJET +2.7%) for as many as 94 of its ERJ175 planes to fly regional routes for American Airlines. RJET plans to buy 47 of the planes initially, and holds the option to buy another 47. If the option is exercised, the deal could mean as much as $4B to ERJ's coffers. Service expected to start in June of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +0.8%) has spiked lower after Muddy Waters joins fellow Chinese short-seller Citron...

    Qihoo (QIHU +0.8%) has spiked lower after Muddy Waters joins fellow Chinese short-seller Citron Research in attacking Qihoo's business practices. MW notes merchants using Alibaba's popular Taobao platform accuse Qihoo of diverting commissions to other accounts by means of code within its 360 browser, and that some have begun a Boycott 360 campaign. Shares were previously up strongly thanks to a bullish note from Macquarie: the firm says checks indicate healthy business trends for Q4 and Q1.
